intro: Rollinia rufinervis, commonly known as the red-veined rollinia, is a tropical plant belonging to the Annonaceae family. It is characterized by its smooth, waxy leaves with prominent red veins, which give it its common name. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in umbels. Its fruit is a rounded, yellow or orange berry that contains several seeds. Rollinia rufinervis is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unique appearance.
